abstract: In combining with Covidien, Medtronic would relocate its headquarters to Ireland from Minneapolis, but argued that its tax rate would remain roughly the same.
snippet: In combining with Covidien, Medtronic would relocate its headquarters to Ireland from Minneapolis, but argued that its tax rate would remain roughly the same.
lead_paragraph: Updated, 10:13 p.m. | Medtronic agreed on Sunday to buy Covidien for $42.9 billion, combining two of the world’s biggest medical device makers and helping Medtronic lower some taxes by gaining access to cash held overseas.

headline.main: Device Maker Medtronic Agrees to Merger and Will Move to Ireland
headline.print_headline: Medtronic Agrees to Merger and Will Move to Ireland

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
